like a vulture over the house of Yahweh,
because they have broken my covenantLiterally “transgressed my covenant”
2They cry out to me,
3Israel has spurned the good;

ul.li2: they made officials, but without my knowledge.
ul.li1: With their silver and gold
5Your calf is rejected,Hebrew “he rejects” or “has rejected you” O Samaria;
How longHebrew “Until when” will they be incapable of innocence?
an artisan made it,
for the calf of Samaria
7Because they sow the wind,
The standing grain does not have heads;Hebrew “head”
And if it would yield,
8Israel is swallowed up;
ul.li2: now they are among the nations,
ul.li3: like an object that no one desires.
ul.li1: 9For they have gone up to Assyria,
ul.li2: a wild donkey alone to itself;

ul.li1: 10Even though they have sold themselves to the nations,
They will soon writhe
ul.li2: from the burden of kingsHebrew “king” and princes.
ul.li1: 11When Ephraim multiplied altars
ul.li3: they became to him altars to sin on.
ul.li1: 12I write for him myriads of my instruction;Or “my law”
ul.li2: they are regarded as a strange thing.

they will return to Egypt.

ul.li1: and Judah has multiplied fortified cities;
ul.li2: but I will send fire on his cities
